message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.MA, cs.DS, cs.CE 

Reasoning: The paper deals with opinion dynamics, which is a topic in social network analysis and computational social science. The use of spatial models and mixing mechanisms suggests a focus on spatial networks and their dynamics, which is covered by the sub-categories cs.SI (social and information networks) and cs.SD (software engineering and programming). The paper also mentions mean-field differential equations, which are a tool commonly used in mathematical analysis of dynamical systems, suggesting a focus on mathematical modeling and analysis, covered by the sub-categories cs.MA (mathematical software) and cs.DS (discrete mathematics). Finally, the paper discusses the effects of mixing on opinion dynamics, which is a topic in computational economics and game theory, covered by the sub-category cs.CE (computational economics and finance).
